entry.content:
How I Posted the First Blog on Github

1. Octopress

What is Octopress

Octopress is a blogging tool build with Ruby, and can be downloaded from Github.

How to build the Octopress

Here is the building process on Ubuntu, and it seems similar on other OS.

Install Git

$sudo apt-get install git

Install Ruby

$sudo apt-get install ruby ruby-dev

Download Octopress

Clone the octopress to local directory octopress: $git clone git://github.com/imathis/octopress.git octopress

Install the dependencies:

Enter the diroctory of octopress: $cd ocopress And type in following command: $gem install bundler $rbenv rehash $bundle install

Install Default Theme of Octopress

$rake install

Initiation and commit source

Before posting a new blog to Github, a respository with the name yourname.github.io is expected to bulid. Then run the setup: $rake setup_github_pages Follow the instuctions and type in what they ask. Finally, generate and deploy your blog site onto Github: $rake generate $rake deploy The source for your blog should also be committed: ``` $git add .
